title: Designing architecture of a rule-based system for managing phone call interruptions.
abstract: Now-a-days, mobile phones are considered to be "always on, always connected" but mobile phone users are not always attentive and responsive to incoming phone calls. Incoming call notifications such as ringing at an inopportune moment (e.g., meeting) can cause interruptions for both the users and the surrounding people. In this paper, we present a  system architecture  for managing call interruptions according to individual's  call response behavioral rules.
